page.title: 09KILBURN(DERBY)AREA EDUCATION
page.content: Our area takes in the easten edge of the Belper area for education. This is the only area of Derbyshire which altered its system of the schooling to that auggested by the Plowden Report of the late 1960's. This system, incorpating first, middle and High schools, which meant children changing school at 9 and 13, is being abandoned from September 1986 in favour of the return to the more common Infant, Junior and comprehisive Schools with tranfer at 7 and 11. The remainder of the the schools in our area operate under that system already. These include one of the best schools in the country, John Flamsteed School at Denby, whose school population is less than 400. this is served by three primary schools, two of which are just outside our area, and kilburn Junior School.
